ref: 8940 prānta n.m. ʻ tip, point ʼ Kauś., ʻ end, edge ʼ MBh. [ánta -- ]

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart

ref: Paš. lāndi ʻ point of a knife ʼ (IIFL iii 3, 111 with?);
S. pāndu m. ʻ border of a garment ʼ, pāndī f. ʻ roll of spun thread as taken off the spindle ʼ, pānduṛu m. ʻ leaves of sugarcane or millet ʼ;
L. pānd, pã̄d m. ʻ end, tail of camel, top of sugarcane ʼ;
P. parã̄dā m. ʻ particoloured yarn used by women for tying up their hair ʼ;
Or. pantāṛa, ˚ra ʻ end ʼ, pantuā ʻ end of cloth worn by a woman during her period ʼ.
